channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: NBA star Steph Curry’s top parenting tip as a father of 4: ‘Learn what they respond to the most’
item.description: “You want to let them know that they each have a superpower and are unique for a reason.”

item.title: More than 9 million student loan borrowers could see a big drop in their credit scores this year
item.description: "This would result in reduced credit limits, higher interest rates for new loans, and overall lower credit access," according to the Federal Reserve.

item.title: Tesla analyst says CEO Elon Musk is ‘back in charge’ after surprise all-hands meeting, and investors are rewarding the company’s stock
item.description: Tesla stock jumped 12% for its best day since November.

item.title: Stocks could be set up for a first-half-of-April rally. Tax Day is a factor.
Durable-goods orders pop as U.S. manufacturers race Trump tariffs
Dollar Tree is selling Family Dollar at a huge loss. Its stock is rising anyway.
Economic calendar: Investor ears peeled for durable-goods data and Fed speakers
Blue-chip Dow up 200 points as it aims for fourth straight gain — live updates
What is Trump really worth? What we know about his business wealth—from real estate to crypto to Truth Social
item.description: The president is worth at least $4.9 billion, and crypto assets like $TRUMP and World Liberty Financial could add billions more.

item.title: The recession could either speed up or slow down when you get your inheritance—experts say these are the huge deciding factors
item.description: Financial experts say that goals tied to gifting, recession timing, and asset liquidity will all matter in the $84 trillion great wealth transfer.
